item.description: About I am a postdoctoral researcher in Statistics at the Department of Economics, Management and Statistics (DEMS) at the University of Milano-Bicocca (Milan, Italy), working under the supervision of Prof. Bernardo Nipoti (DEMS, University of Milano-Bicocca). I received my PhD in Statistics at the Universiy of Padova (Padova, Italy) in 2022, supervised by Prof. Antonio Canale (Department of Statistical Sciences, University of Padova) and Prof. Michele Guindani (Department of Biostatistics, UCLA).

Contact Office 2092/b, second floor U7 building. Department of Economics, Management and Statistics (DEMS) University of Milano-Bicocca Piazza dell’Ateneo Nuovo 1, 20126 Milan Email laura.dangelo@unimib.it

Articles in refereed journals Denti F. and D’Angelo L. (2025) The generalized nested common atoms model. Econometrics and Statistics, 1–28 (in press). DOI: 10.1016/j.ecosta.2025.01.001. Article - Citation D’Angelo L. and Denti F. (2024) A finite-infinite shared atoms nested model for the Bayesian analysis of large grouped data. Bayesian Analysis, 1–34 (in press). DOI: 10.1214/24-BA1458. Article - Citation D’Angelo L. and Canale A. (2023) Efficient posterior sampling for Bayesian Poisson regression.

Statistical Modelling course Third year course of the B.Sc. course in Artificial Intelligence (Universities of Milano-Bicocca, Milano Statale and Pavia). A.A. 2023/2024, 1st semester. 6 CFU (32 hours lectures, 24 hours exercise classes). Communications 10/01/2024: The exam will include 2 or 3 exercises (in line with the exercises seen during the course). Please bring: ✓ a calculator, ✓ ID or student card, ✓ a pen. Course notes, books, and other materials are NOT allowed (including mobile phones, smart watches, etc).

Statistical Modelling course Third year course of the B.Sc. course in Artificial Intelligence (Universities of Milano-Bicocca, Milano Statale and Pavia). A.A. 2024/2025, 1st semester. 6 CFU (32 hours lectures, 24 hours exercise classes). Communications The class scheduled for Tuesday, November 12 (h. 12.30) is canceled. The class scheduled for Tuesday, October 15 (h. 12.30) is canceled. We will regularly meet on Thursday, October 17 (h. 11.30). Please enroll to the course on the Kiro platform to receive communications.

Conference presentations Invited talk: “Flexible modeling of grouped multivariate data via Bayesian shared-atom nested mixture models”; CMStatistics 2024, London, UK; December 14 – 16, 2024. Invited talk: “Uncovering the heterogeneity of the neuronal activity in calcium imaging studies via Bayesian mixture models”; ISBA 2024, Venezia, Italy; July 1 - 7, 2024. Invited talk: “Two-level clustering of patients and hospitals via thinned dependent Dirichlet process mixtures”; SIS 2024, Bari, Italy; June 17 - 20, 2024.
Teaching Statistical Modelling (A.A. 2024/2025) B.Sc. course in Artificial Intelligence. Inter-university project of the Universities of Milano-Bicocca, Milano Statale and Pavia.
